intro: Scleria woodii, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and spike-like inflorescences that bear small, three-lobed flowers. Scleria woodii typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats such as marshes and swamps. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems, contributing to soil stabilization and providing habitat for various organisms.
